{"step_by_step_thinking": "Occlusal interferences refer to any abnormal contact between the upper and lower teeth during biting or chewing. Nervous tension can lead to increased muscle activity and tension in the jaw, which can manifest as various habits. Bruxism is a habit characterized by grinding or clenching of the teeth, often during sleep or times of stress. Thumb sucking is a habit commonly seen in children, where they suck their thumb for comfort. Tongue thrusting is a habit where the tongue pushes against the front teeth during swallowing or at rest. Given that occlusal interferences can lead to increased muscle tension and nervous tension, it is likely that all of the above habits can be triggered by occlusal interferences.", "answer_choice": "D"}
